title: %help magic chokes when parsing retrieved HTML
body:
#### Problem description When using the `%help` magic, the kernel throws an exception while (it looks like from the logs) trying to parse the HTML fetched from [stata.com/help.cgi](https://www.stata.com/help.cgi?oneway). This results in no output for any invocation of `%help` except the built-in `%help kernel` and `%help magics` commands. #### Debugging log [console_debug.log](https://github.com/kylebarron/stata_kernel/files/6371461/console_debug.log) More saliently this is the python output from stderr of the jupyterlab process: ``` [IPKernelApp] ERROR | Exception in message handler: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ipykernel/kernelbase.py", line 261, in dispatch_shell yield gen.maybe_future(handler(stream, idents, msg)) File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/tornado/gen.py", line 762, in run value = future.result() File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/tornado/gen.py", line 234, in wrapper yielded = ctx_run(next, result) File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/ipykernel/kernelbase.py", line 536, in execute_request self.do_execute( File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/stata_kernel/kernel.py", line 110, in do_execute code = self.magics.magic(code, self) File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/stata_kernel/stata_magics.py", line 228, in magic code = getattr(self, "magic_" + name)(code, kernel) File "/opt/conda/lib/python3.8/site-packages/stata_kernel/stata_magics.py", line 633, in magic_help soup.find('a', text='Copyright').find_parent("table").decompose() AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'find_parent' ``` #### Expected Output An inline rich-text help as described in the [stata_kernel manual](https://kylebarron.dev/stata_kernel/using_stata_kernel/magics/#help). #### Other information It looks from the error output that `stata_magics.py` is trying to parse the DOM tree for an `` element containing the text 'Copyright', but rather than checking whether it found one, just assumes it is present—and then the call to `.find_parent()` is choking, because it’s not. I am guessing that in a previous version of stata.com/help.cgi some portion of the HTML quoted below was wrapped in an `` tag, and that it’s subsequently been rewritten. ```html
© Copyright 1996–2021 StataCorp LLC   •   Terms of use   •   Privacy   •   Contact us
``` I wonder if this is also the cause of #321.
